intro: Diplotaxis praecox, commonly known as the early diplotaxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a feathery appearance. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
